etomica.util

Class FunctionChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.util.FunctionChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFunction, Function, java.io.Serializable

    public final class FunctionChain
extends java.lang.Object
implements Function, java.io.Serializable
    Defines a function as chain of other functions. For example, defines F(x) = f3(f2(f1(x))). Defaults to identity function if no subfunctions are specified.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FunctionChain.Link
      Class for making linked list of Functions

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(IFunction newF)
      Adds the given function to the chain of functions.
      double df(int n, double x)
      Evaluates derivative via the chain rule.
      double f(double x)
      Calculates function by applying subfunctions, in the ordered they were added.
      double inverse(double f)
      Inverts function by calling inverse methods of subfunctions, in reverse order of their addition.

      • f

        public double f(double x)
        Calculates function by applying subfunctions, in the ordered they were added.
        Specified by:
        f in interface IFunction

      • inverse

        public double inverse(double f)
        Inverts function by calling inverse methods of subfunctions, in reverse order of their addition.

      • df

        public double df(int n,
                 double x)
        Evaluates derivative via the chain rule.

      • add

        public void add(IFunction newF)
        Adds the given function to the chain of functions. Functions are applied sequentially in the order they are added. First function added is the first applied, and so on.

      • remove

        public void remove(IFunction f)
        Removes the given function from the chain. If the function is not in the chain, returns with no error or warning message. If function is present multiple times in chain, remove the first one added.
